typical window wall, through a store front, through the
walkway and stair, and through any special parapet con-
dition or upper-level roof terraces.

e. Exterior Lighting and Signs



i. Exterior lighting locations, type of fixtures and intensi-
ties shall be indicated.

ii. Details of signs shall be submitted. In the absence of
final lettering details, an overall size of sign, location,
construction materials, and method of illumination shall
be shown. The developer should pay particular attention
to the criteria contained in item B of Signs in Charles
Center, Procedures and Guidelines, f)?ges 26 and 27
herein.



f. Special Features



Any special features suchas pools, snow melting equipment,
sculpture, planting, or the like shall be clearly located and
noted.

g. Outline Specifications



i. Outline specifications shall be submitted in sufficient de-
tail to make clear the color and texture of all exterior
building materials, paving, and methods of construction.

h. Cost Estimate <



Estimated cost of construction per gross square foot of
space enclosed (including mechanical and electrical equip-
ment, and fees for engineering and/or architectural work
consisting of preliminary and final drawings, specifications,
and supervision of construction).

5 Time of Construction



An estimate of the number of calendar days required for
preparation of final preliminary plans, construction plans,
and for actual construction, together with the dates by which
the developer would be prepared to begin and complete con-
struction.

‘.

(Optional) Any alternate design which the developer wishes to
have considered by the Agency and which does not violate the
Charles Center Urban Renewal Plan. However, no alternate
design which violates the standards and controls, as described
in this Prospectus and/or the disposition agreement, will be
considered by the Agency unless:

a. The Developer has also submitted a basic design which does
